page.title: 01SOUTH BEDFORD :1
page.content:
The part of Bedford south of the river is one of outstanding interest. Bedford's origins are post-Roman and the town plan was laid down in the tenth century. Much of this plan still remains today in the town centre, both north and south of the River Great Ouse. The town was fortified against the Danish invaders and to the south of the river, this involved the construction of a bank and ditch, King's Ditch.
Outside this fairly small area, there was little development until the 19th century when large numbers of houses were built along and off Ampthill Road.
